problem.p: A binary system consists of stars of masses \(m\) and \(2m\), separated by distance \(L\). The stars are revolving in circular orbits around their common center of mass. The centripetal acceleration of the star with the smaller mass is \(a_c\).
problem.part:
What is the centripetal acceleration \(a'_c\) of the other star?
\(a'_c = a_c\)/2\(a'_c = Gm^2 / L^2\)\(a'_c = Gm^2 / L\)\(a'_c = Gm / (2L^2)\)\(a'_c = 2Gm / L^2\)\(a'_c = 2a_c\)

Find the period of revolutions of the stars.
\(T=2 \pi \sqrt{2L/(3a)}\)\(T=2 \pi \sqrt{3L/(2a)}\)\(T=2 \pi \sqrt{L/a}\)\(T=2 \pi \sqrt{L/(3a)}\)\(T= \pi \sqrt{2L/(3a)}\)\(T=4 \pi \sqrt{L/(3a)}\)
